title: For Trump, Nothing Was Off Limits During the Shutdown
summary: President Trump pressured Democrats by taking punishing actions no previous administration ever took during a shutdown.

title: Senate Passes Bill to Reopen Government Amid Democratic Rift
summary: The vote, on Day 41 of the shutdown, signaled an end in sight to weeks of gridlock. Eight members of the Democratic Caucus supplied the critical backing.

title: Flight Delays and Cancellations Won’t Immediately Stop When Government Shutdown Ends
summary: There is hope the Thanksgiving holiday will be spared, but carriers will need some time to deal with the disruptions that the shutdown has caused for air travel.

title: Bookstore Food Drives Help Food Stamp Recipients
summary: During the government shutdown, booksellers are collecting food for Americans who receive federal aid to buy groceries.

title: How the Heavy-Metal Fall of a Dictator Shapes Trump’s Venezuela Policy
summary: Seizing Panama’s leader was relatively easy. But the similarities between Panama and Venezuela are dangerously misleading, some analysts warn.

title: ‘It Feels Like I’m in a Nightmare’: Inside the First Deportation Flight to Iran
summary: For decades, Iranians fleeing persecution have found protection in the United States. But this fall, the Trump administration deported a planeload of people to Iran after making a deal with Tehran.

title: Halt in Fees on Chinese Vessels Endangers U.S. Shipbuilding Efforts
summary: The two countries agreed to suspend the fees for a year as part of their recent trade pact, but America still aims to build more commercial ships.

title: Trump Wants to Revive Shipping. He Will Need More Mariners.
summary: Few American are becoming mariners today, but demand could soon rise because President Trump and a bipartisan group of legislators in Congress want to revitalize the American shipbuilding industry.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Hit Specialty Grocery Stores for Some Immigrant Communities Especially Hard
summary: For immigrant communities from countries with especially high duties, food costs have risen sharply courtesy of President Trump.

title: The NYC Demographic Trends That Shaped Mamdani’s Win
summary: Moderate Black voters and young progressives favored Zohran Mamdani for mayor, while Andrew Cuomo won many wealthy New Yorkers and those who voted for Donald Trump.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker Describes Her Year as a Booker Prize Judge
summary: The actor had to read so many books (153) she bowed out of most family activities. Still, she said, collaborating to pick a winner was worth the sacrifice.

title: Accused of Desecration, a Doctor Faces the End of His Life’s Work
summary: Dr. Masahide Kanayama has devoted his life in Manhattan to medicine and God. He could face five years of hard labor in Japan.

title: Why So Many People Are Turning to Collective Screaming
summary: It’s a practice with roots in Greek tragedy, which has a lot to teach us about the power — and limits — of raised voices.

title: The Young Women Grappling With an ‘Old Man’s Disease’
summary: Diagnosed with A.L.S., they traded stories, drank tequila and made grim jokes at a unique annual gathering on Cape Cod.

title: The Volunteer Buglers Giving 24-Note Salutes
summary: Thousands of musicians — civilians, veterans, teenagers, retirees — are playing taps at military funerals in a rebuke of technology.

title: Judge Rejects Utah’s Republican-Drawn Redistricting Map
summary: The judge instead adopted a map drawn by a centrist coalition. Democrats celebrated the ruling ahead of the 2026 midterms, but Republicans vowed to fight it.

title: SoftBank Sells $5.8 Billion Stake in Nvidia to Pay for OpenAI Deals
summary: The move has further stoked concerns among some investors that the rally in artificial intelligence stocks was overdone.

title: In West Virginia’s Maternity Deserts, a Midwife Fills a Void
summary: Staysha Quentrill is part of a small group trying to revive Appalachia’s tradition of at-home midwifery — in a state where women drive hours for obstetric care.

title: Use A.I. to Reinvigorate Democracy — Not Replace It
summary: Governments shouldn’t hand over decision-making to A.I.

title: On Veterans Day, This Is the Lonely, Terrible Sorrow We Must Never Forget
summary: To imagine the cost of an “America First” policy, walk through World War II cemeteries in Europe.

title: Late Night Is Disappointed in Democrats Over Shutdown Deal
summary: “Our long national nightmare is different,” Stephen Colbert said after some Democratic senators voted with Republicans to end the government shutdown.

title: Iraqis Are Voting for a New Parliament. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Iraq is caught in a power struggle between Washington and Tehran, with the Trump administration insisting that the next government disarm powerful Iran-backed militias.

title: Pakistan ‘in a State of War’ After Explosion Kills 12 in Capital
summary: An attack on a courthouse in Islamabad was the first major assault to hit Islamabad in more than a decade.

title: The Mysterious ‘Louvre Detective’ Was a 15-Year-Old Passer-by
summary: The photo of a dapper man in a fedora sparked many questions: Was the person real? A Sherlock Holmes-inspired detective on the case? Or just being very French?

title: Ban a Pro-Palestinian Group? The U.K. Government Thought Few Would Care.
summary: Official advice provided to the government before its ban on Palestine Action underestimated the significant public protests that followed, records show.
